bug.short_desc: SEO on qooxdoo doc and api

long_desc.thetext:
For a better research on search engines, we should think about a "facade" for our website content.
Every indexed site should be pointed to one path, the current version.
Force http://manual.qooxdoo.org/current/ Deny http://manual.qooxdoo.org/1.2.2/
Better research for users will be the afford. For deprecated old manual page we could always leave the last version but with a hint to the guilty version.
The api viewer app can be index by google as well. So just using of #! is needed. Example: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/apiviewer/#!qx.bom.element.Dataset This page could index by google. Same as on website / manual, just allow google to index one path.

(In reply to comment #0) > For a better research on search engines, we should think about a "facade" for > our website content. > > Every indexed site should be pointed to one path, the current version. > > Force http://manual.qooxdoo.org/current/ > Deny http://manual.qooxdoo.org/1.2.2/ > > Better research for users will be the afford. For deprecated old manual page we > could always leave the last version but with a hint to the guilty version. That means we should only offer a link to current and thats it? Remove all links to the versions?
> The api viewer app can be index by google as well. So just using of #! is > needed. > Example: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/apiviewer/#!qx.bom.element.Dataset > This page could index by google. Same as on website / manual, just allow google > to index one path.
We already use the # for the classes and methods. Is the #! required by google?

(In reply to comment #1) > We already use the # for the classes and methods. Is the #! required by google?
The hash-bang lets Google know that the page content has been updated by an AJAX call.
We will also need to make sure Google finds the hash-bang links. Since we don't use link elements in the API Viewer GUI, we could generate an XML sitemap along with the JSON API data.
Added a "sitemap" sub-key to the "api" job key. The "api-verify" job in the framework uses this to create framework/api/sitemap.xml (with 639c01e4 on master).
